intro: Stravadium insigne, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its ornamental value and hardiness make it a sought-after plant among horticulturists and garden enthusiasts.
